result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Done on record

1:30 PM Defendant JACOB J VENTURA in court.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for PD services but is awaiting appointment. Defendant requests substitution. Court grants substitution.
Eligible for SPD Services
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Arraignment on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

4:01 PM Defendant JACOB J VENTURA in court, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin.  
DA Parker - provided DE w/copy of complaint. DE advised DA documents were being faxed to the Court, has not seen yet.  Court reviews file, DE is eligible for Pub. Def. (none appointed yet).  Provides DE w/2options.  DE chooses to proceed w/prelim.  Court reviews prelim & attorney rights w/DE.  DE waives right to have attorney present at prelim and wants to continue today.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for this hearing. 
Lt. N. Prey sworn & testifies.   Witness id's DE. DA Parker requests Court take Judicial Notice of JOC - Outagamie Co. case 18CF170 filed on 1/9/2019.  Court  takes judicial notice. DE's objection - relevance - DA Parker explains.  DE responds. Court sees relevance, overrules objection. Court reminds DE of 5th Amendment right.  Cross exam.  Objection - not in form of questions - sustained.

Arguments.  Defendant makes a statement regarding witnesses.  Court will not continue this matter.  Defendant requests matter be dismissed.  Court makes its findings, finds probable cause and binds over.  Information will mirror the complaint.  Discussion regarding prompt disposition vs. arraignment.  Defendant states he will be filing more motions.
Eligible for SPD Services
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

1:04 PM Defendant JACOB J VENTURA appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge gives the defendant right to have an attorney.  He wants an attorney but no one appointed yet.  Defendant filed a prompt disposition.  Defendant has copy of complaint but doesn't understand this charge. 
ADA Nelson cites criminal record and requests $10,000 signature bond.  No travel.
